title: NO POTTING UP METHOD FOR TOMATO SEEDLINGS  - One Cup Method for Huge Tomatoes

tasks.task: Starting tomatoes from seed indoors using solo cups with bottom watering method.
subtasks: Gather materials (solo cups, seed starting mix, water, grow light, tray with rim).
Drill drainage holes in solo cups.
Moisten seed starting mix before filling cups.
Fill cups halfway with moistened seed starting mix, pack soil down.
Plant 2-3 tomato seeds on surface, cover with 1/4 inch of mix and vermiculite.
Water by adding 2-3 inches of water to the tray daily, discarding excess.
Use grow light for initial sprouting, then move to windows or greenhouse.
After 4-6 weeks, trim lower leaves and fill cups with potting soil.
Allow plants to harden off before transplanting to garden.
Choose tomato plants (from the one-cup method or other sources).
Prepare garden soil by tilling, adding compost or fertilizer.
Create rows or hills for tomatoes, spaced as recommended (e.g., 2-3 feet apart).
Dig holes for plants, plant at the original depth (avoid burying stems), water in.
Apply mulch around plants to retain moisture and control weeds.
Weed garden regularly to prevent competition.
Water plants as needed, ensuring even moisture (adjusting for rainfall and season).
Monitor for pests and diseases, using appropriate organic or chemical controls.
Prune tomatoes to remove suckers and maintain plant form (optional for indeterminate varieties).
Support plants with cages, stakes, or trellises.
Apply fertilizer when necessary (e.g., tomato food) following package instructions.
Check plants regularly for ripening fruit.
Pick tomatoes when fully colored and slightly soft.
Store harvested tomatoes at room temperature for best flavor.
